author: Jon Sharman
title: Foreign spouse income limit: Supreme Court rules financial barrier lawful, barring entry to thousands of couples | The Independent
text:
The Supreme Court has said the Government's Â£18,600 income threshold that bars UK workers' foreign spouses is lawful.
The policy, brought in when Theresa May was Home Secretary, has been blamed for keeping families apart because British citizens living in the UK do not earn enough money to bring their partners to the country. It holds even if their partner's earnings would tip them over the limit.
The court's decision means thousands of couples may remain apart. But it said the rules have been poorly applied in certain circumstances.
Britons have previously told The Independent they have had to move abroad to be with their families because of the policy.
